post_info.post_title: Could an Eunuch Be Ordained as a Priest. . .

In the Roman Catholic Church?

 
 Wikipedia notes that the priesthood was 'canonically closed' to Peter Abelard after his castration. I don't know if things have changed since the twelfth century.

Wikipedia notes that the priesthood was 'canonically closed' to Peter Abelard after his castration. I don't know if things have changed since the twelfth century.

 
 Remarkably, no replies from our resident Catholics. Are we to assume that things haven't changed since the twelfth century? In which case, do candidates for the papacy have to pass some kind of virility test? Do tell.

I'm not Catholic, but I am pretty familiar with their traditions and beliefs. I don't believe there is any rule against a eunuch being ordained. Some very early catholic church leaders like Origen of Alexandria were in fact eunuchs.

Wikipedia notes that the priesthood was 'canonically closed' to Peter Abelard after his castration. I don't know if things have changed since the twelfth century.
Thank you, John Hanks, I finally woke up and saw your reply.

My study agrees with Jyoshu. There appears to be nothing prohibiting it at thist time.
 
 EF
